what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Functions handle mixed-mode surveys.

what: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
title: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
text: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) logistic model weights equal 1

title: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
code: Fisher_Information_Matrix(prob, Z, maskSubset = !logical(nrow(Z)))

title: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
text: prob probability answer. Can true estimated. Can equal NA units subset defined maskSubset (numeric vector size N size population). Z design matrix. rows corresponding units subset can contain NA (numeric matrix N rows q columns). maskSubset mask indicating unit used calculation FIM. Default entire set (logical vector size N).

title: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
text: Fisher Information Matrix estimation (numeric matrix order q).

text: N number statistical units. (stricly positive integer) M list expected modes. Must non-empty, composed strings made unique values. (character vector)

text: Check outcomes

what: Check the table of outcomes. — checkY_tab
title: Check the table of outcomes. — checkY_tab
text: One row unit one column mode

title: Check the table of outcomes. — checkY_tab
code: checkY_tab(Y_tab, N = nrow(Y_tab), K = ncol(Y_tab), M = colnames(Y_tab))

title: Check the table of outcomes. — checkY_tab
text: Y_tab table containing outcome values different modes available. May contain missing values. Available values must finite. N number statistical units. (stricly positive integer) M list expected modes. Must non-empty, composed strings made unique values. (character vector)

what: Check if a vector of values is a vector of unique modes — check_M
title: Check if a vector of values is a vector of unique modes — check_M
text: Check vector values vector unique modes

title: Check if a vector of values is a vector of unique modes — check_M
code: checkM(...)  assertM(...)

title: Check if a vector of values is a vector of unique modes — check_M
text: checkM(): check vector M assertM(): assert vector M

what: Check if a vector supposedly containing mode affectation for each unit is correct. — check_modes
title: Check if a vector supposedly containing mode affectation for each unit is correct. — check_modes
text: Can contain NA values. must least one unit answered.

title: Check if a vector supposedly containing mode affectation for each unit is correct. — check_modes
code: checkModes(...)  assertModes(...)  checkMode(...)  assertMode(..., .var.name = checkmate::vname(...), add = NULL)

title: Check if a vector supposedly containing mode affectation for each unit is correct. — check_modes
text: checkModes(): check assertModes(): assertion checkMode(): check unique mode assertMode(): assertion unique mode

what: Check if a vector is a vector of probability — check_probability
title: Check if a vector is a vector of probability — check_probability
text: Check vector vector probability

title: Check if a vector is a vector of probability — check_probability
code: checkProbabilityVec(   x,   len = NULL,   min.len = 1L,   max.len = NULL,   unique = FALSE,   striclyPos = FALSE,   striclyUnsure = FALSE,   any.missing = FALSE )  assertProbabilityVec(   x,   len = NULL,   min.len = 1L,   max.len = NULL,   unique = FALSE,   striclyPos = FALSE,   striclyUnsure = FALSE,   any.missing = FALSE,   .var.name = checkmate::vname(x),   add = NULL )  checkProbabilityScalar(...)  assertProbabilityScalar(...)

title: Check if a vector is a vector of probability — check_probability
text: checkProbabilityVec(): check vector probability assertProbabilityVec(): assert vector probability checkProbabilityScalar(): check scalar probability assertProbabilityScalar(): assert scalar probability

title: Check related to variances — check_variances
text: Check related variances

title: Check related to variances — check_variances
code: checkVariances(...)  assertVariances(...)  checkCovarMat(mat, p = nrow(mat))  assertCovarMat(   mat,   p = nrow(mat),   .var.name = checkmate::vname(mat),   add = NULL )  checkCorMat(mat, p = nrow(mat))  assertCorMat(mat, p = nrow(mat), .var.name = checkmate::vname(mat), add = NULL)

title: Check related to variances — check_variances
text: checkVariances(): Check variances standard deviations assertVariances(): Assert variances standard deviations checkCovarMat(): Check variance-covariance matrix assertCovarMat(): Assert variance-covariance matrix checkCorMat(): Check correlation matrix assertCorMat(): Assert correlation matrix

what: Évaluation des estimations via Monte-Carlo — estim_MC
title: Évaluation des estimations via Monte-Carlo — estim_MC
text: Évaluation des estimations via Monte-Carlo

title: Évaluation des estimations via Monte-Carlo — estim_MC
code: bias_MC(estims, target)  var_MC(estims)  sd_MC(estims)  MSE_MC(estims, target)  CV_MC(estims, target = mean(estims))

title: Évaluation des estimations via Monte-Carlo — estim_MC
text: estims vecteur numérique des estimations target valeur cible / vraie valeur (réelle)

title: Évaluation des estimations via Monte-Carlo — estim_MC
text: bias_MC(): Estimation du biais var_MC(): Variance empirique corrigée des estimations sd_MC(): Écart-type empirique corrigé des estimations MSE_MC(): Erreur quadratique moyenne par rapport à l'estimateur CV_MC(): Coefficient de variation (par défaut estimé via la moyenne des estimations)

what: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
title: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
text: version considers case two modes. generalised.

title: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
code: estim_counterfactuals(Yobs, modes, X, ...)

title: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. non-respondents value considered therefore can equal NA (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. first mode protocol defined "m1" second "m2" (character vector factor size N). X design matrix. rows corresponding non-respondents can contain NA (numeric matrix N rows p columns). ... arguments function MatchIt::matchit.

title: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
text: mode vector size N containing respondent outcome estimated counterfactual depending answered mode . Equal NA non-respondents (numeric matrix dimension (N,2)).

what: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
title: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
text: suppose homoscedasticity within first second modes response potential outcomes. unbiased estimator non-informativeness, unconfoundedness conditional mutual independence assumptions verified ; measure effect y_1k - y_2k  follow linear model x_k units potential outcomes known (sequential protocol). must least p + 1 (p number covariates) units measure effect known well estimated. standard deviations sd1 sd2 must unbiased well.

title: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
code: estim_cov_12(   Y1,   Y2,   sd1,   sd2,   X,   Yobs = NULL,   modes = NULL,   clamp = FALSE,   warnClamp = TRUE,   ... )

title: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
text: Y1 vector first mode outcomes (numeric vector size N size population). Y2 vector second mode outcomes (numeric vector size N). sd1 true estimated value standard deviation first mode response potential outcomes (positive scalar). sd2 true estimated value standard deviation second mode response potential outcomes (positive scalar). X design matrix (numeric matrix N rows p columns). Yobs vector observed outcomes. Optional. Useful Y1 Y2 given. case counterfactuals respondents estimated function estim_counterfactuals. value considered therefore can equal NA (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. Optional. Used counterfactuals must estimated (character vector factor size N). clamp TRUE estimation covariance must clamped absolute value superior sd1 * sd2 (boolean). warnClamp TRUE warning must sent clamp made (boolean). ... arguments function MatchIt::matchit.

title: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
text: estimator covariance m1 m2 potential outcomes, unbiased assumptions, sd1^2 sd2^2 unbiased counterfactuals true values (scalar).

title: Estimation of t_ay — estim_tot_a
text: Estimation t_ay

title: Estimation of t_ay — estim_tot_a
code: estim_tot_a(Yobs, responses, pi, pa)

title: Estimation of t_ay — estim_tot_a
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. non-respondents value considered therefore can equal NA (numeric vector size N size population). responses vector indicating unit answered. unit answered corresponding value "r" (character vector factor size N). pi vector containing inclusion probabilities pi_k. Can equal NA non-respondents (numeric vector size N). pa vector containing true estimated probabilities p_ak. Can equal NA non-respondents (numeric vector size N).

title: Estimation of t_ay — estim_tot_a
text: estimation total t_ay (scalar).

title: Estimation of t_1 — estim_tot_m1
text: Estimation t_1

title: Estimation of t_1 — estim_tot_m1
code: estim_tot_m1(Yobs, modes, pi, p1, phi = rep(1, length(Yobs)))

title: Estimation of t_1 — estim_tot_m1
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. m1 non-respondents value considered therefore can equal NA (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. first mode protocol defined "m1" (character vector factor size N). pi vector containing inclusion probabilities pi_k. Can equal NA m1 non-respondents (numeric vector size N). p1 vector containing true estimated probabilities p_1k. Can equal NA m1 non-respondents (numeric vector size N). phi optional vector containing weights total. Must known m1-respondents (numeric vector 0,1^N).

title: Estimation of t_1 — estim_tot_m1
text: estimation total t_1, possibly weighted (scalar).

title: Estimation of t_phiy — estim_tot_m1_m2
text: Estimation t_phiy

title: Estimation of t_phiy — estim_tot_m1_m2
code: estim_tot_m1_m2(Yobs, modes, pi, p1, p2, phi = rep(0.5, length(Yobs)))

title: Estimation of t_phiy — estim_tot_m1_m2
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. non-respondents value considered therefore can equal NA (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. first mode protocol defined "m1" second "m2" (character vector factor size N). pi vector containing inclusion probabilities pi_k. Can equal NA non-respondents (numeric vector size N). p1 vector containing true estimated probabilities p_1k. Can equal NA non-respondents (numeric vector size N). p2 vector containing true estimated probabilities p_2k. Can equal NA non-respondents (numeric vector size N). phi optional vector containing weights total. Must known respondents (numeric vector 0,1^N).

title: Estimation of t_phiy — estim_tot_m1_m2
text: estimation total t_phiy (scalar).

title: Estimation of t_2 — estim_tot_m2
text: Estimation t_2

title: Estimation of t_2 — estim_tot_m2
code: estim_tot_m2(Yobs, modes, pi, p1, p2, phi = rep(1, length(Yobs)))

title: Estimation of t_2 — estim_tot_m2
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. m2 non-respondents value considered therefore can equal NA (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. second mode protocol defined "m2" (character vector factor size N). pi vector containing inclusion probabilities pi_k. Can equal NA m2 non-respondents (numeric vector size N). p1 vector containing true estimated probabilities p_1k. Can equal NA m2 non-respondents (numeric vector size N). p2 vector containing true estimated probabilities p_2k. Can equal NA m2 non-respondents (numeric vector size N). phi optional vector containing weights total. Must known m2-respondents (numeric vector 0,1^N).

title: Estimation of t_2 — estim_tot_m2
text: estimation total t_2, possibly weighted (scalar).

title: Transformation de matrices d'interaction — mats_interaction
text: Les fonctions suivantes transforment des matrices contenant des informations sur les interactions entre variables (ex : corrélation) en d'autres matrices.

title: Transformation de matrices d'interaction — mats_interaction
code: cor2cov(cor, sigmas)

title: Transformation de matrices d'interaction — mats_interaction
text: cor Matrice de corrélation (matrice) sigmas Vecteur des écarts-types. Doit être de même taille que l'ordre de cor.

title: Transformation de matrices d'interaction — mats_interaction
text: cor2cov(): Transformation d'une matrice de corrélation en une matrice de variance.

what: Simulation du choix des modes sous un modèle de Poisson — sampling_mode
title: Simulation du choix des modes sous un modèle de Poisson — sampling_mode
text: Simulation du choix des modes sous un modèle de Poisson

title: Simulation du choix des modes sous un modèle de Poisson — sampling_mode
code: sim_ind_MM(p, seed = NULL)  sim_ind_MM_eq_prob(N, modes, addNR = TRUE)

title: Simulation du choix des modes sous un modèle de Poisson — sampling_mode
text: seed graine aléatoire à utiliser pour la reproductibilité. Si vaut NULL alors la graine n'est pas fixée. N Taille de la population modes Liste des différents modes disponibles (vecteur). Possibilité que ce soit un entier, auquel cas considérera autant de modes, plus éventuellement de la non-réponse.

title: Simulation du choix des modes sous un modèle de Poisson — sampling_mode
text: sim_ind_MM(): Simulation d'un choix de mode pour chaque individu de manière indépendante sim_ind_MM_eq_prob(): Simulation de sélection avec probabilités égales pour tous les modes et tous les individus

title: Simulation parameter — seed
text: Simulation parameter

title: Simulation parameter — seed
code: fix_seed(seed = NULL)

title: Simulation parameter — seed
text: seed graine aléatoire à utiliser pour la reproductibilité. Si vaut NULL alors la graine n'est pas fixée.
